conversation.text: I'm delighted you're open to exploring films that feature bisexuality! If you're into a mix of mystery and drama, you might enjoy "Velvet Goldmine" (1998). This film delves into the glam rock era with an intriguing plot and stars Christian Bale and Eddie Izzard. Another captivating choice is "My Own Private Idaho" (1991), a road movie about friendship, self-discovery, and relationships starring River Phoenix and Keanu Reeves. Both films offer unique perspectives on bisexuality and are worth checking out!

If you're looking for something with a bit of humor mixed in, "Due Date" might also be up your alley. It's a road trip comedy featuring Danny McBride and Robert Downey Jr., exploring the unexpected bond between two very different individuals on their way to a baby's birth. Both films have a strong sense of journey, which I thought might appeal to you based on your interest in 'On the Road'. Enjoy!

If you're interested in a more modern family film, "Unaccompanied Minors" (2006) is another great choice. This movie tells the heartwarming story of a group of kids who bond while snowed in at an airport during the holiday season. It features a fun cast including Rob Riggle and Mindy Kaling. Enjoy!

It sounds like you're in for an action-packed movie marathon! Given your preference for David Costabile and action films, I'd highly recommend "Escape from New York" (1981). This film is a classic with Kurt Russell in the lead role as Snake Plissken, a man tasked with rescuing the U.S. President who crash-lands in a post-apocalyptic Manhattan turned maximum security prison.

Another movie that might interest you is "Avatar" (2009), directed by James Cameron. This visually stunning film tells the story of a paraplegic marine on Pandora, a distant world with exotic creatures and a native people at risk from human invaders. Sigourney Weaver, Stephen Lang, and Sam Worthington star in this thought-provoking action adventure. Enjoy your movie time!
